body_html:
I think this is some weirdness interaction with ipython and conda environments and possibly bash's caching of the path. I installed pytorch but forgot to install ipython into the new environment initially. Ipython (from root enviroment) couldn't find torch on import --this was expected.

But it still couldn't import torch from ipythonn even after I installed ipython into my pytorch environment. Surprising!

It resolved though just by starting up a new shell and activated the environment again and it worked.
body_text:
I think this is some weirdness interaction with ipython and conda environments and possibly bash's caching of the path. I installed pytorch but forgot to install ipython into the new environment initially. Ipython (from root enviroment) couldn't find torch on import --this was expected.
But it still couldn't import torch from ipythonn even after I installed ipython into my pytorch environment. Surprising!
It resolved though just by starting up a new shell and activated the environment again and it worked.
body:
I think this is some weirdness interaction with ipython and conda environments and possibly bash's caching of the path. I installed pytorch but forgot to install ipython into the new environment initially. Ipython (from root enviroment) couldn't find torch on import --this was expected.

But it still couldn't import torch from ipythonn even after I installed ipython into my pytorch environment. Surprising!

It resolved though just by starting up a new shell and activated the environment again and it worked.
